editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: F-157r: Psalter. F-135v: 151 Psalms of David. The word for God is unrubricated. The midpoint of the Psalter is marked by a later hand which circled the line in pencil. Psalm 151 is the short version. F-149v: 15 Biblical Canticles. Canticle four is "Prayer of Hana, mother of Samuel, prophetess." F-157r: Song of Songs, common version. F-170v: Praises of Mary, arranged for the days of the week: Monday (158r), Tuesday (159r), Wednesday (161r), Thursday (163v), Friday (166r), Saturday (167v), Sunday (169r). F-176r: Gate of Light. Varia: : Excerpt from Praises of Mary. : A copy of the inscription on a bell given by Emperor Failadas (1632-1667) to the Church of St. Cyriacus of Wance Bahr, in Ge'ez, but by a later hand. : A deleted note in Ge'ez. : note deleted so thoroughly that the language cannot be determined. : Note in Amharic concerning the recitation of the Psalter. Ornamental designs, f, 62v, 75r, 84r, 90r, 104v, 118v, 121v, 128v, 136r, 149v, 157r, 176r. Crude cross, . : note of ownership by Walda Giyorgis (including information from Macomber, Catalogue).

origin.origDate: late-18th / early-19th century (Macomber); but I say early 18th

revisionDesc.change: Created XML record from EMIP Collection Metadata.xsls
